title: How to Make Seafood Fettuccine

steps.headline: Boil the dry pasta into a large pot of salted water.
steps.description: Cook until pasta is al dente, taking about 8-10 minutes.

steps.headline: Drain the pasta into a colander and gently shake it around to remove excess water.
In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter until it has completely melted.
Fold in the garlic and onions.
steps.description: Cook and stir with a wooden spoon for about a minute.

steps.headline: Stir in the scallops, shrimp, and clams.
steps.description: Cook for an additional 3 minutes and reduce the heat to medium-low.

steps.headline: Add the half and half, salt, and pepper and simmer the mixture.
steps.description: Continue to stir and bring up the heat, but do not boil.

steps.headline: Sprinkle a half cup of the Parmesan cheese over the seafood mixture.
steps.description: Stir well until well-combined.

steps.headline: Shut off the stove and remove the seafood mixture from the heat.
Toss in the cooked pasta into the skillet.
steps.description: Mix well and sprinkle over the rest of the cheese.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Place the seafood fettuccine in a serving bowl and garnish with extra cheese or herbs, if desired. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Prepare the lobster.
steps.description: Twist off the tails of the lobsters and slice each tail into half lengthwise. Remove the lobster meat from the tails and slice the meat into chunks. Open the claws and remove all the lobster meat from the claw place into a bowl.

steps.headline: Boil the dry pasta into a large pot of salted water.
steps.description: Cook until pasta is al dente, taking about 8-10 minutes.

steps.headline: Drain the pasta into a colander and gently shake it around to remove excess water.
On medium heat in a large skillet, combine the garlic, shallot, lobster, salt, and hot pepper flakes.
steps.description: Cook for about a minute until the mixture is fragrant.

steps.headline: Pour in the wine and cook for an additional minute.
Stir in the whipping cream, parsley, and pasta.
steps.description: Toss around together.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Place the seafood fettuccine in a serving bowl and garnish with cheese or herbs, if desired. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Boil the dry pasta into a large pot of salted water.
steps.description: Cook until pasta is al dente, taking about 8-10 minutes.

steps.headline: Drain the pasta into a colander and gently shake it around to remove excess water.
In a large skillet on medium heat, combine the shrimp, garlic, and butter.
steps.description: Stir well.

steps.headline: Add the half and half and mix with a wooden spoon.
Add the Parmesan cheese, adding a tablespoon at a time.
steps.description: Continue to stir well.

steps.headline: Fold in the parsley and mix well.
steps.description: Mix until the sauce begins to thicken.

steps.headline: Add the pasta into the sauce and toss until well-combined.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the seafood fettuccine in a serving bowl and garnish with cheese or herbs, if desired. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Drain the crab meat and remove any shell pieces.
In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter until fully melted.
Add the garlic and cook until it becomes tender.
Pour in the half and half and bring the mixture to a boil.
Turn down the heat and allow it to simmer.
steps.description: Stir with a whisk every 5 minutes to help the sauce thicken.

steps.headline: Fold in the pasta, crab, cheese, and parsley.
steps.description: Stir well and toss to coat properly.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Place the seafood fettuccine in a serving bowl and garnish with cheese or herbs, if desired. Enjoy!

steps.headline: Boil the dry pasta into a large pot of salted water.
steps.description: Cook until pasta is al dente, taking about 8-10 minutes.

steps.headline: Cut each scallop into halves by slicing horizontally.
Drain the pasta into a colander and gently shake it around to remove excess water.
In a large skillet on medium heat, add the oil, red pepper, lemon peel, garlic, and pepper flakes.
steps.description: Stir and cook for about two minutes.

steps.headline: Add the broth, wine, and lemon juice.
steps.description: Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to a simmer for about 5-6 minutes. .

steps.headline: Fold in the scallops into the mixture and cook for about 4-5 minutes.
steps.description: Cook until the scallops have fully cooked and are firm.

steps.headline: Shut off the stove and remove from heat.
Combine the pasta and cheese together and toss well.
Serve.
steps.description: Place the seafood fettuccine in a serving bowl and garnish with extra cheese or herbs, if desired. Enjoy!

text: Basic Seafood Fettuccine Boil the dry pasta into a large pot of salted water. Cook until pasta is al dente, taking about 8-10 minutes. Drain the pasta into a colander and gently shake it around to remove excess water.  In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter until it has completely melted.  Fold in the garlic and onions. Cook and stir with a wooden spoon for about a minute. Stir in the scallops, shrimp, and clams. Cook for an additional 3 minutes and reduce the heat to medium-low. Add the half and half, salt, and pepper and simmer the mixture. Continue to stir and bring up the heat, but do not boil. Sprinkle a half cup of the Parmesan cheese over the seafood mixture. Stir well until well-combined. Shut off the stove and remove the seafood mixture from the heat.  Toss in the cooked pasta into the skillet. Mix well and sprinkle over the rest of the cheese. Serve. Place the seafood fettuccine in a serving bowl and garnish with extra cheese or herbs, if desired. Enjoy! Lobster Fettuccine Prepare the lobster. Twist off the tails of the lobsters and slice each tail into half lengthwise. Remove the lobster meat from the tails and slice the meat into chunks. Open the claws and remove all the lobster meat from the claw place into a bowl. Boil the dry pasta into a large pot of salted water. Cook until pasta is al dente, taking about 8-10 minutes. Drain the pasta into a colander and gently shake it around to remove excess water.  On medium heat in a large skillet, combine the garlic, shallot, lobster, salt, and hot pepper flakes. Cook for about a minute until the mixture is fragrant. Pour in the wine and cook for an additional minute.  Stir in the whipping cream, parsley, and pasta. Toss around together. Serve. Place the seafood fettuccine in a serving bowl and garnish with cheese or herbs, if desired. Enjoy! Shrimp Fettuccine Boil the dry pasta into a large pot of salted water. Cook until pasta is al dente, taking about 8-10 minutes. Drain the pasta into a colander and gently shake it around to remove excess water.  In a large skillet on medium heat, combine the shrimp, garlic, and butter. Stir well. Add the half and half and mix with a wooden spoon.  Add the Parmesan cheese, adding a tablespoon at a time. Continue to stir well. Fold in the parsley and mix well. Mix until the sauce begins to thicken. Add the pasta into the sauce and toss until well-combined.  Serve. Place the seafood fettuccine in a serving bowl and garnish with cheese or herbs, if desired. Enjoy! Crab Fettuccine Drain the crab meat and remove any shell pieces.  In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter until fully melted.  Add the garlic and cook until it becomes tender.  Pour in the half and half and bring the mixture to a boil.  Turn down the heat and allow it to simmer. Stir with a whisk every 5 minutes to help the sauce thicken. Fold in the pasta, crab, cheese, and parsley. Stir well and toss to coat properly. Serve. Place the seafood fettuccine in a serving bowl and garnish with cheese or herbs, if desired. Enjoy! Scallops Fettuccine Boil the dry pasta into a large pot of salted water. Cook until pasta is al dente, taking about 8-10 minutes. Cut each scallop into halves by slicing horizontally.  Drain the pasta into a colander and gently shake it around to remove excess water.  In a large skillet on medium heat, add the oil, red pepper, lemon peel, garlic, and pepper flakes. Stir and cook for about two minutes. Add the broth, wine, and lemon juice. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to a simmer for about 5-6 minutes. . Fold in the scallops into the mixture and cook for about 4-5 minutes. Cook until the scallops have fully cooked and are firm. Shut off the stove and remove from heat.  Combine the pasta and cheese together and toss well.  Serve. Place the seafood fettuccine in a serving bowl and garnish with extra cheese or herbs, if desired. Enjoy!
